conbody.p: The recommended deployment architecture requires two identical dual-NIC machines for best disk synchronization and network responsiveness. However, you can deploy an HA cluster with single-NIC servers if two identical dual-NIC machines are not available.

section.title: Requirements for two identical dual-NIC servers

ul.li: Master hosts: In a separate resource pool, you need two identical hosts in the role of master host; one host serves as the primary node and the other as the secondary node.

Provide two NICs on the HA cluster primary node and two on the secondary node. On each node, dedicate one NIC to
network traffic that is required for disk synchronization via DRBD.
and application traffic.
Route traffic for each NIC through separate subnets.

Delegate hosts: You need N+1 identical hosts to serve as delegate hosts, where N is the number of hosts needed to satisfy the performance and scalability requirements of the pool. They do not need to be members of the HA cluster because, if a host becomes unavailable, restarts services on other hosts.
Deploy application services on dedicated delegate hosts outside the HA cluster.

Master host: Configure two hosts for the master host in an active/passive cluster.
Use the two hosts only to run . Do not use them to run application services.
For primary and secondary nodes that contain only one network-interface card (NIC), the network they use to communicate must support multicast.

Delegate hosts: You need N+1 identical hosts to serve as delegate hosts, where N is the number of hosts needed to satisfy the performance and scalability requirements of the pool. (Only the master hosts must be configured in an active/passive cluster.)
